text: Jimmy Boyd (January 9, 1939 – March 7, 2009) was an American musician and actor. He became known for his performance and recording of "I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus". He was born James Boyd in McComb, Mississippi. He died from cancer, age seventy, in Santa Monica, California. == Early life and career == Jimmy Boyd was born on January 9, 1939, in McComb, Mississippi, to a musical family. He gained national attention at the age of 13 when he recorded “I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus”, which became an instant hit. The song topped the charts in 1952 and sold millions of copies. Boyd's success with this recording launched his career as both a musician and actor . == Acting career == In addition to his musical success, Boyd appeared in several television shows and films. He worked with stars such as Milton Berle and Dean Martin, showcasing his versatility as a performer. He had guest roles in popular shows like Bachelor Father and Date with the Angels . == Later life and death == Boyd continued to perform throughout his life, though his fame gradually waned. He passed away on March 7, 2009, at the age of 70 in Santa Monica, California, after battling cancer. ==References== Category:Actors from Mississippi Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles County, California Category:Musicians from Mississippi Category:1939 births Category:2009 deaths
